title: Wreay Woods Walking Route

images.title: Brian Norman / St Mary's Church, Wreay
images.caption: St Mary's Church, Wreay. The noteworthy church is the earliest known example in Britain of a revival of Lombard architecture.The building is Grade II listed.

description: This walk visits the pretty Wreay Woods near Carlisle in Cumbria. The scenic woods are something of a hidden gem and a nice place for an easy nature walk near the city. The walk starts in the little village of Wreay and follows footpaths east to visit the woods. Here you can pick up a nice riverside footpath heading north along the River Petteril towards Newbiggin Wood and Carleton. It's a lovely peaceful place with countryside views, bridges over the river and old mills to see. The area is also classed as a nature reserve so look out for a variety of flora and fauna as you make your way across the path. Keep your eyes peeled for kingfisher, dippers and even otters by the river. In the spring there are also pretty bluebells in the woods to admire.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head east to Wetheral and you can enjoy another pleasant waterside walk along the River Eden. For more walking ideas in the area see the Cumbria Walks page.

display_address: St Cuthbert Without, Wreay, Cumberland, England, CA4 0RL, United Kingdom
